snippet: Bradley Birkenfeld, who got out of jail last month after serving time for helping Americans dodge taxes, received a lavish bonus for his role in exposing tax schemes at UBS.
abstract: Internal Revenue Service reveals that Bradley C Birkenfeld, a former UBS banker who has served two and a half years in prison for evading taxes, has received $104 million as an award for his help in revealing the secrets of the Swiss banking system; Birkenfeld's award, the largest ever paid in the IRS whistle-blower program, could spur a surge in new whistle-blower complaints.
lead_paragraph: Bradley Birkenfeld, who got out of jail last month after serving time for helping Americans dodge taxes, received a lavish bonus for his role in exposing tax schemes at UBS.

headline.seo: I.R.S. Awards $104 Million to Bradley Birkenfeld, a Whistle-Blower
headline.print_headline: Get Out of Jail Free? No, It’s Better
